attributes.action: Cap what motorway services can charge HGV drivers for food and drink.
attributes.background: HGV drivers are legally obligated to take regular breaks. Often due to routes & vehicle dimensions it is only safe & suitable to stop at services. Drivers are then forced to pay a high premium to consume basic food and drink from their outlets as there is few alternatives.

rejection.details:
This is the responsibility of retailers at service stations, not the Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition asking Parliament to change the law, to require employers of HGV drivers to pay allowances for food and drink consumed during legally-required rest stops.
